title: Fix LocationUpdateManager not registering on bus after relaunch
message:
Fix LocationUpdateManager not registering on bus after relaunch

After app close, singletons are still alive and won't be recreated. So LUM never registers again after relaunch.

Start Service in Main again

otherwise service might not be restarted after close and relaunch

title: Merge pull request #185 from cbalster/simplify_last_known_location_handling
message:
Merge pull request #185 from cbalster/simplify_last_known_location_handling

Simplify last known location handling

title: Simplify last known location handling
message:
Simplify last known location handling

Just query all providers for their last known locations and treat those like regular fixes by piping them through our normal flow.
This:
- makes MapFragment agnostic of last known locations
- makes use of the existing heuristics and removes the need to handle this as a special case

title: Remove last known location and timestamp preferences
message:
Remove last known location and timestamp preferences

These are only used to set the map location until there is a real fix and only if the location is no older than 5 minutes.
In virtually all cases except for a device restart and immediate launch of the app, LocationManager.getLastKnownLocation() will provide equivalent or even better results.

title: submit only precise locations to backend
message:
submit only precise locations to backend

Introduces the notion of a precise location into ownLocationModel (accuracy < 50m for now).
This way we can show the user a location quickly while only sending out good fixes to the server.

title: fix crash on ICS
message:
fix crash on ICS

AsyncTasks must be started from the UI thread and as of JELLYBEAN this is automatically taken care of.
Since we're running it from a TimerTask - which is a separate thread - we have to take care of this ourselves
for devices running ICS and lower.
fixes #42

title: Merge pull request #41 from cbalster/fix_marker_leak
message:
Merge pull request #41 from cbalster/fix_marker_leak

Fix memory leak due to osmbonuspack bug

title: Fix memory leak due to osmbonuspack bug
message:
Fix memory leak due to osmbonuspack bug

The Marker class holds a static reference to a DefaultInfoWindow instance
which in turn holds a reference to the MapView. Thus it leaks the entire
view hierarchy when the fragment is detached.
Work around this by sub classing marker and implementing Overlay's
onDetach() method to null out the static references there.
Also move common initialization code to the subclass.

title: Merge pull request #38 from cbalster/make_foreground_service
message:
Merge pull request #38 from cbalster/make_foreground_service

Make foreground service

title: make service a foreground service
message:
make service a foreground service

This makes it less likely that the process is killed by android due to memory pressure.
This also moves all the notification handling to the service and and makes sure the
notification is shown for the entire service lifecycle.
Note that there is no need to explicitly cancel the notification as this is automatically
taken care of when the service stops.

message:
Merge pull request #37 from cbalster/opt

misc optimizations

title: Fix Marker InfoWindow handling
message:
Fix Marker InfoWindow handling

By default omsbonuspack markers open an info bubble onClick. This requires a
"bonuspack_bubble.xml" layout to be present, which is inflated on marker
instantiation. We don't have that, so every marker throws an exception.
Since the infowindow is not needed, handle this by adding a dummy layout and
by calling setInfoWindow(null) on every marker.

title: handle menu items in activity
message:
handle menu items in activity

Fragments should only ever handle menu items that are fragment specific
and added by the fragment itself. Implementing the callbacks in a superclass
and thus instantiating them with every fragment can lead to all kinds of
weird behavior (see the sternfahrt checkbox state).

title: Don't query osrm api for sternfahrt routes
message:
Don't query osrm api for sternfahrt routes

getRoad() will always query the osrm API for routing information. As this is
done on the main thread the app will be unresponsive. Additionally most queries
will fail because the generated URLs are too long. In consequence getRoad()
will fall back to generating the Road by only using the waypoints.
Since the raw waypoints are already precise enough and none of the additional
information is used, just construct the Road directly.

title: notification handling is done in the service
message:
notification handling is done in the service

...so remove it from here

title: fix shutdown code
message:
fix shutdown code

Using System.exit() to is bad practice. In this specific case it prevents the service
from properly shutting down as stopService() is asynchronous. Therefore onDestroy()
is never executed, because the process has already been killed.
Instead of force-killing let Android do it's thing.

title: properly handle service shutdown
message:
properly handle service shutdown

onTaskRemoved() is not called when the service is stopped using stopService().
So move cleanup code to onDestroy() and only trigger the service stop there.
Also properly cancel the Timer.

title: Merge pull request #24 from cbalster/fix_keyboard_handling
message:
Merge pull request #24 from cbalster/fix_keyboard_handling

improve softkeyboard handling

title: improve softkeyboard handling
message:
improve softkeyboard handling

When the softkeyboard has been opened at least once in the chat fragment,
it needs to be hidden on fragment change since the chat fragment is still
in a "visible" state and the EditText keeps focus. As of now this is done
by hiding the keyboard whenever a new tab is selected. Unfortunately this
doesn't handle the case when the Activity is resumed via notification
since the EditText still gets the focus and therefore the keyboard is
opened again.
This patch works around this by making the parent Layout focusable and
removing focus from the EditText when leaving the chat fragment. Also only
do this when we're leaving the chat fragment.
